title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify the profit-maximizing quantity as 33 units and/or does not explain that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.
The response identifies the profit-maximizing quantity as 33 units and explains that at that quantity marginal revenue is equal to marginal cost.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state the firm earns positive economic profit and/or does not explain that the firm’s average total cost curve is below the demand curve, or the firm charges a price above than the average total cost, or P > ATC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGqbGaaeiiai aab6dacaqGGaGaaeyqaiaabsfacaqGdbaaaa@3E39@ .

The response states that the firm earns positive economic profit and explains that the firm’s average total cost curve is below the demand curve, or the firm charges a price above than the average total cost, or P > ATC MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGqbGaaeiiai aab6dacaqGGaGaaeyqaiaabsfacaqGdbaaaa@3E39@ .

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate EyesOn’s total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $1,188 and/or does not show the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $27×44 = $1,188 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aabsfacaqGVbGaaeiDaiaabggacaqGSbGaaeiOaiaabkfacaqGLbGa aeODaiaabwgacaqGUbGaaeyDaiaabwgacaqGGcGaaeypaiaabckaca qGqbGaaeOCaiaabMgacaqGJbGaaeyzaiabgEna0kaabgfacaqG1bGa aeyyaiaab6gacaqG0bGaaeyAaiaabshacaqG5bGaaeiOaiaab2daca qGGcGaaeijaiaabkdacaqG3aGaey41aqRaaeinaiaabsdacaqGGcGa aeypaiaabckacaqGKaGaaeymaiaabYcacaqGXaGaaeioaiaabIdaaa a@6634@

The response calculates EyesOn’s total revenue at the allocatively efficient quantity as $1,188 and shows the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity = $27×44 = $1,188 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaqaaaaaaaaaWdbi aabsfacaqGVbGaaeiDaiaabggacaqGSbGaaeiOaiaabkfacaqGLbGa aeODaiaabwgacaqGUbGaaeyDaiaabwgacaqGGcGaaeypaiaabckaca qGqbGaaeOCaiaabMgacaqGJbGaaeyzaiabgEna0kaabgfacaqG1bGa aeyyaiaab6gacaqG0bGaaeyAaiaabshacaqG5bGaaeiOaiaab2daca qGGcGaaeijaiaabkdacaqG3aGaey41aqRaaeinaiaabsdacaqGGcGa aeypaiaabckacaqGKaGaaeymaiaabYcacaqGXaGaaeioaiaabIdaaa a@6634@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that at that price ($10) the firm will shut down in the short run and/or does not explain it’s because the price is below the average variable cost which means the firm does not generate enough revenue to pay for its variable costs, so the firm loses more by producing, in the short run, than shutting down and just paying its fixed cost.

The response states that at that price ($10) the firm will shut down in the short run and explains it’s because the price is below the average variable cost which means the firm does not generate enough revenue to pay for its variable costs, so the firm loses more by producing, in the short run, than shutting down and just paying its fixed cost.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, EyesOn does not have a dominant strategy and/or does not explain that when ViewTime does not advertise, EyesOn’s payoff is higher when it chooses to maintain its price ( $2,000 > $1,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeOmai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeymaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434C@ ), and when ViewTime chooses to advertise, EyesOn’s payoff is higher when it chooses to lower its price ( $4,000 > $3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@4350@ ); therefore, EyesOn does not have a dominant strategy.

The response states that no, EyesOn does not have a dominant strategy and explains that when ViewTime does not advertise, EyesOn’s payoff is higher when it chooses to maintain its price ( $2,000 > $1,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeOmai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa aeymaiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@434C@ ), and when ViewTime chooses to advertise, EyesOn’s payoff is higher when it chooses to lower its price ( $4,000 > $3,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGGaGaaeOpaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdaaaa@4350@ ); therefore, EyesOn does not have a dominant strategy.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify Nash equilibrium as EyesOn lowers its price and ViewTime advertises with payoffs of ($4,000, $3,400) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F6@ , and/or does not explain that if EyesOn chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $4,000 to $3,000, and if ViewTime chooses not to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $3,400 to $2,600; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response identifies Nash equilibrium as EyesOn lowers its price and ViewTime advertises with payoffs of ($4,000, $3,400) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F6@ , and explains that if EyesOn chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $4,000 to $3,000, and if ViewTime chooses not to advertise, its payoff will decrease from $3,400 to $2,600; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that no, this offer will not result in a Nash equilibrium with different strategies and/or does not explain that the Nash equilibrium strategies will still be for EyesOn to lower its price and ViewTime to advertise with payoffs of ($4,000, $3,400) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F6@ because if EyesOn chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $4,000 to $3,500 ( =$3,000 + $500 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqG9aGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGa aeijaiaabwdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@429C@ ), and if ViewTime chooses to not advertise, its payoff will decrease from $3,400 to $2,600; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy. Or explain that with the offer ViewTime’s dominant strategy will continue to be to advertise because its payoff will always be higher ( $3,400> $2,600 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4mai aabYcacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqG+aGaaeiiaiaabscacaqGYaGa aeilaiaabAdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42B5@ and $7,000> $6,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaae4nai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqG+aGaaeiiaiaabscacaqG2aGa aeilaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42B3@ ) and since EyesOn has no dominant strategy it is better off lowering the price ( $4,000> $3,500 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGKaGaaeinai aabYcacaqGWaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqG+aGaaeiiaiaabscacaqGZaGa aeilaiaabwdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@42B2@ ); therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.

The response states that no, this offer will not result in a Nash equilibrium with different strategies and explains that the Nash equilibrium strategies will still be for EyesOn to lower its price and ViewTime to advertise with payoffs of ($4,000, $3,400) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGOaGaaeijai aabsdacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeilaiaabccacaqGKaGa ae4maiaabYcacaqG0aGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGPaaaaa@43F6@ because if EyesOn chooses to maintain its price, its payoff will decrease from $4,000 to $3,500 ( =$3,000 + $500 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqG9aGaaeijai aabodacaqGSaGaaeimaiaabcdacaqGWaGaaeiiaiaabUcacaqGGaGa aeijaiaabwdacaqGWaGaaeimaaaa@429C@ ), and if ViewTime chooses to not advertise, its payoff will decrease from $3,400 to $2,600; therefore, there is no incentive for either firm to change its strategy.
